definition: youngest/most junior/tiny/one (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers, esp. on telephone or in military)/one or ace on dice or dominoes/variant of 吆[yao1], to shout

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
lit. to burn both fragrant orchids and stinking weeds (idiom); fig. to destroy indiscriminately the noble and common/the rain falls on the just and unjust alike
female chicken crows at daybreak (idiom); a woman usurps authority/women meddle in politics/The female wears the trousers.
to stare in anger/a look of hatred
piece of paper with short note/short letter
Your presence brings light to my humble dwelling
(old) to burn paper money as an offering
lit. it is not an official to be feared, but a person in direct control over sb (proverb)/fig. to be obliged to comply with people in authority
pinyin: bu4 pa4 guan1 , zhi3 pa4 guan3
